comments.author: mr.bo@live.com
comments.text:
Created attachment 572355
Screen Glitch1.jpg

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111102223350

Steps to reproduce:

While browsing normally I notice this problem on certain sites. I have checked to see if this happens with Chrome, or IE, and it does not.


Actual results:

The desktop, or any window behind the Firefox window shows through Firefox.


Expected results:

the website images should appear correctly
comments.raw_text:

comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.text:
Nice effect:)

OK, try to disable HW acceleration in tools->options->advanced->general.
comments.raw_text:
Nice effect:)

OK, try to disable HW acceleration in tools->options->advanced->general.

comments.text: Thanks :aceman.  That totally did the trick.
comments.raw_text: Thanks :aceman.  That totally did the trick.
comments.creator: mr.bo@live.com
comments.author: mr.bo@live.com

comments.raw_text:
Well, good to hear that, but we'll still need to find the culprit.
Could you enable HW acceleration again, restart Firefox and post contents of the Graphics section of about:support here?

comments.raw_text:
OK, you seem to have uptodate drivers.

Do you know when it started?
Can you give any URLs where this happens? You said only on some sites.
comments.text:
OK, you seem to have uptodate drivers.

Do you know when it started?
Can you give any URLs where this happens? You said only on some sites.

comments.raw_text:
I just updated to the newest video drivers the day before posting this bug in case the issue was on my side.  It has been happening for a few weeks at least.  Possibly a month.  I believe it started when I updated Firefox to version 7. I am currently using version 8.  I first noticed it on Facebook.  The blue top bar would show up as translucent, and I would be able to see my desktop through it.  I thought it was possibly a Facebook issue.  When I first visited the guild site below I noticed the same issue, but a lot worse so I tested the same sites on IE, and Chrome with no problems at all.

It happens all the time on this site:  http://synergy.swtorlaunch.net/
comments.text:

The blue top bar would show up as translucent, and I would be able to see my desktop through it.  I thought it was possibly a Facebook issue.  When I first visited the guild site below I noticed the same issue, but a lot worse so I tested the same sites on IE, and Chrome with no problems at all.

It happens all the time on this site:  http://synergy.swtorlaunch.net/
